image.altText: Mitchell Starc pumps both fists as he kneels in the field after taking a catch. Another fielder runs towards him.

items.synopsis: What appears to be a clean catch to remove Ben Duckett is sensationally overturned late on day four of the second Ashes Test, leaving England 257 runs away from victory heading into day five at Lord's.

title.children: 'A disgrace … ridiculous': Overturned catch ends day four at Lord's on controversial note

image.altText: A model wearing white walks along a catwalk behind a purple background that reads ELLERY

items.synopsis: Celebrated fashion designer Kym Ellery defends her handling of the 2019 collapse of her Australian business.

title.children: Designer Kym Ellery's edgy outfits won over celebrities. Her 2019 fashion business collapse left suppliers owed millions

image.altText: Rachel Perkins with an award.

items.synopsis: Black excellence and community leadership are honoured at the 2023 National NAIDOC Week Awards in Brisbane.

title.children: ‘Stand with us, Australia’: NAIDOC Award winner’s message on the Voice

image.altText: The Aboriginal flag flies against a blue sky.

items.synopsis: The Yes case for the referendum on an Indigenous Voice to Parliament is hoping intensified campaigning from this weekend will turn around softening support.

title.children: Indigenous Voice to Parliament Yes camp intensify campaign as referendum draws closer

image.altText: A mural depicting the Wagner Group painted on a building in Belgrade, Serbia

items.synopsis: Vladimir Putin's darkest battles are being carried out by a number of private armies run by Russia's elite, but after an attempted uprising, the Russian president is facing the reality they could turn on him, writes Isabella Higgins.

title.children: Could Putin face another mutiny from his mercenaries? Wagner was just one of the pay-to-kill groups fighting for Russia

image.altText: Australian currency

items.synopsis: Managing household budgets and finances aren't everyone's cup of tea, so we've put together this guide with advice to ease cost-of-living pressures.

title.children: Stuck on how to redo the household budget? Here are some ways to ease the financial squeeze

image.altText: A man looks sad after losing a rugby league match

items.synopsis: Wests Tigers have hit a new low with the joint venture suffering the heaviest defeat in NRL history on a horror night in North Queensland.

title.children: NRL wrap: Records tumble as Wests Tigers concede biggest score in NRL history

image.altText: Nathan Lyon walks off Lord's ahead of the English team

items.synopsis: An injured Nathan Lyon hobbles onto Lord's to help add 15 extra runs, before Mitchell Starc delivers a trademark wicket to stunt England's run chase. Here are five things you missed overnight from the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title.children: Five quick hits — Nathan Lyon martyrs himself and Mitch Starc produces an all-time classic

image.altText: A pot boils on a gas stove in a residential kitchen

items.synopsis: When Steven Secker's hot water heater broke, the pensioner was backed into a corner. Amid a growing push for households to electrify their appliances and move away from gas, social services warn people like Mr Secker could be left behind in any transition.

title.children: Getting off gas is meant to be the future, but transitioning your home comes with a cost

image.altText: Ashleigh Keating wears a red scarf and denim jacket

items.synopsis: Experts in the field say there's growing concern that students with disability are potentially missing out on the care they need with training and qualifications for teacher aides differing around the country.

title.children: Students with disability 'failed' by inadequate teacher aide qualifications, training

image.altText: Billy stands with two men painted up on a beach

items.synopsis: When surfer, artist and Dharug man Billy Bain journeyed up the NSW coast to spend time with local First Nations communities, he discovered a special connection to his country and culture — and a quiet sense of confidence to tell his story.

title.children: As a kid Billy was shamed into hiding his Indigenous culture but this surfing trip changed everything

image.altText: A young mother with long brown hair and glasses sitting on a playground with her young son

items.synopsis: As the National Disability Insurance Scheme marks 10 years, it's become apparent reform is needed. As the tussle to reign in costs intensifies, participants want the wider community to recognise the investment is life-saving and not a frivolous expense.

title.children: As the NDIS turns 10, this is what participants and their families want you to know about the scheme

image.altText: Two officers in military gear holding large guns stand on a street.

items.synopsis: A new law gives Paris police the right to deploy drones in some areas as tens of thousands of officers are deployed nationwide.

title.children: France braces for fifth night of rioting as police tear gas protesters

image.altText: Water falling over rock edge

items.synopsis: More than 50 million litres of water is permitted to be extracted from bores within a stone's throw from a UNESCO world heritage rainforest in the Gold Coast hinterland, as groups call for tighter regulation.

title.children: Water destined for plastic bottles is being pumped from beside this world heritage rainforest. Calls are growing for it to end

image.altText: Albanese smiles in the cold dawn light, the warm colour of a grand autumnal tree fills the background behind him.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese believes Australians will welcome the news of a larger than expected budget surplus even as their own budgets continue to take a battering.

title.children: PM defends $19 billion budget surplus labelled as 'dumb luck' by Opposition

image.altText: A headshot of a young woman with blonde hair looking off camera.

items.synopsis: Police searching for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer say a hiker in the area has responded to a plea to come forward to help with any further information about her movements.

title.children: Police searching for missing Belgian tourist speak to hiker about her movements at waterfall track

image.altText: Girl looking straight at camera with spinifex bush in background.

items.synopsis: Kira Gusterson heard rumours of a "Pilbara tax" before she moved to the iron ore mining region — but she was still shocked by the cost of living.

title.children: Living in a mining town when you're not on a mining wage

image.altText: A young Chinese man standing in front of Sydney Opera House.

items.synopsis: A compulsory online module is teaching international students at Australian universities about consent and inspiring some to take their new-found sex education back home. But Chinese students say there's still a long way to go.

title.children: Francis never got taught how to use condoms in China. Then he came to Australia

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

items.synopsis: For years, debate has raged in the nation's capital about the need for a federal anti-corruption watchdog — one with actual teeth. Now the National Anti-Corruption Commission is here, so what will it achieve?

title.children: The army major general turned federal anti-corruption boss officially starts today — what's ahead of him?

image.altText: Wedge-tailed eagle in flight

items.synopsis: Australian raptors like the wedge-tailed eagle and peregrine falcon are natural predators of corellas and other cockatoos. Now they are being deployed to keep them away.

title.children: Is this the ultimate scarecrow to move marauding corellas on?

image.altText: Copy of Kerr1

items.synopsis: From parenthood to pride numbers, the Matildas represent so much more than just an inclusive team; they embody the entire culture of women's football on and off the field.

title.children: 'We always play with pride': How the Matildas helped pave the way for LGBTQIA+ visibility in football

image.altText: Sign informing of new Spanish mackerel changes is attached to a sign at a jetty.

items.synopsis: Fisheries Queensland says new catch limits are to rebuild the fishery for future generations, but the state's peak seafood body says new reductions to Spanish mackerel quotas are "nonsense".

title.children: Going fishing? There are new rules for Queenslanders from today

image.altText: A woman plays a cricket shot.

items.synopsis: Needing just five off the last over to win, Australia scrapes home on the penultimate ball to solidfy their grasp on the Women's Ashes.

title.children: Australia survives late scare as Mooney masterclass guides Aussies to victory at Edgbaston

image.altText: A group of Super Netball players jump around together in the middle of the court after winning a key final.

items.synopsis: The NSW Swifts book their place in the Super Netball grand final, thanks to some clutch shooting in a 65-64 win over the West Coast Fever.

title.children: Swifts to face Thunderbirds in Super Netball grand final after win over Fever

image.altText: A woman resting her chin on her hand smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Millions of Australians are opting for career changes, but experts say the window may be closing to get the most out of the "Great Reshuffle". This is how mid-career professionals jumped at the chance for an occupation transformation and set themselves up for a more fulfilling work future.

title.children: Would you take a $50,000 pay cut? Why these mid-career professionals aren't looking back

image.altText: a cloud band forms over the kimberley

items.synopsis: Unseasonable rain continues to fall across Australia's north in what's meant to be the region's dry season, helping lower temperatures to near-record levels.

title.children: Why holiday-makers heading north for winter sun could be in for unpleasant surprise

image.altText: A nexus of welded metal coated in sand.

items.synopsis: Coral fields destroyed by weather and bleaching have been growing back at "very successful" rates, thanks to some simple seabed technology and local expertise.

title.children: After a decade of bleaching and cyclone damage, coral shoots of recovery are emerging

image.altText: A medium sized bird, patterned black, white and yellow, on a tree branch.

items.synopsis: There are fewer than 300 regent honeyeaters in the wild but after a concerning breeding season, conservationists are encouraged by recent sightings along the east coast.

title.children: Sightings of one of Australia's rarest birds spark hope, as fight to save species continues

image.altText: Aboriginal man with Aboriginal flag on a blue T-shirt on a balcony with the beach behind him.

items.synopsis: The collection of staged photographs from the 1900s depicting Birpai people in traditional dress and poses from a bygone era receives heritage listing.

title.children: A family secret led John to preserve heritage photos. But he needs help finding a mystery man

image.altText: A Kenyan man in army gear stands at site of crash with people standing behind tape.

items.synopsis: In one of the deadliest recent traffic accidents in the country, a truck carrying a shipping container veers out of control at a busy junction.

title.children: Truck carrying shipping container hits crowd, killing 52 in Kenya

image.altText: Two women in 1800s period-costume dresses walk past timber huts.

items.synopsis: Jack Yabsley, a former presenter of Saturday Disney and Totally Wild, describes his new TV series Gold Diggers as an anti-patriarchal, "grubby, political, silly, sexy comedy".

title.children: Former kids' TV presenter creates bawdy comedy about women on Australia's goldfields
